intro: Carex davidi var. ascocentra, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a perennial plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its compact size and attractive appearance. Botanically, it belongs to the Cyperaceae family and is valued for its ability to tolerate wet conditions.
